processes.description:
Computes the Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI). The NDVI is computed as *(nir - red) / (nir + red)*.

The `data` parameter expects a raster data cube as NetCDF including Sentinel2-Data. This cube has three dimensions and two data variables. Dimension are time, lon and lat while data variables are red and nir.

. As a result of the computation, a NetCDF-File including the NDVI-values is created in the given path.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Name of data input / data cube.

returns.description: A dask.delayed.Delayed object containing the computed NDVI values. Additionally, this is saved as NetCDF under the given path.

processes.description: Computes the arithmatic mean of sst data. The arithmetic mean is defined as the sum of all elements divided by the number of elements. The user defines a timeframe and optionally also a spatial subset, for which the mean is to be computed. For each day in the given timeframe the sea surface temperature values for a cell are summed up and divided by the number of days in the timeframe. This is done for all cells within the spatial subset or, if no bounding box was defined, for all cells in the dataset.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: A raster data cube containing sst data.

parameters.name: timeframe
parameters.description: An array with two values: [start date, end date]. Timeframe values are strings of the format 'year-month-day'. For example: '1981-01-01'.

parameters.name: bbox
parameters.description: An array with four values: [min Longitude, min Latitude, max Longitude, max Latitude]. For example: [0,-90,360,90]

returns.description: A raster data cube containing the computed mean sea surface temperature.

InvalidBboxLengthError.message: Parameter bbox is an array with four values: [min Longitude, min Latitude, max Longitude, max Latitude]. Please specify an array with exactly four values.

InvalidTimeframeLengthError.message: Parameter timeframe is an array with two values: [start date, end date]. Please specify an array with exactly two values.

InvalidTimeframeValueError.message: Timeframe values are strings of the format 'year-month-day'. For example '1981-01-01'. Please specify timeframe values that follow this format.

ValueError.message: The timeframe values are invalid. Please specify actual dates as start and end date.

links.title: Sea surface temperature explained by Wikipedia

processes.summary: Saves the Result in the specified  format with the specified name.
processes.description: Saves the Result in the specified  format with the specified name.

parameters.name: SaveData
parameters.description: Specify the name of Former process which result will be saved

parameters.name: Format
parameters.description: The File Format. Available formats are netcdf

returns.description: Returns a boolean which indicates if the save was successfull

InvalidFileFormat.message: Invalid File Format. Compatible Formats are: netcdf

InvalidFileName.message: Invalid File Name. Please choose an other name

processes.summary: Load a specified Collection. Viable Collections are seen in the description

parameters.name: timeframe
parameters.description: An array with two values: [start date, end date]. Timeframes have to use datetime64[ns]

parameters.name: cloudcoverage
parameters.description: Array with cloudcoverage in percent. It contains two  values  [min  percent, max  percent]

parameters.name: DataType
parameters.description: Specify which Datatype. Avaiable are 'SST' data and 'Sentinel2' Data
